Key Match Events: Tatum punctuated the rally with a trio of free throws.
Denver didnâ€™t have enough gas in the tank to complete a comeback and lost for the second time in three games.
The Celtics snatched the momentum and were up 86-79 following a Tatum 3-pointer with 1:47 to go in the period.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum had 29 points, Kristaps Porzingis finished with 25 points and 11 rebounds and the visiting Boston Celtics beat the short-handed Denver Nuggets 118-106 on Tuesday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston was without guard Derrick White due to an illness.
Russell Westbrook scored 26 points and grabbed nine rebounds for Denver, which played without reigning MVP Nikola Jokic and forward Aaron Gordon.
Others: Jamal Murray and Julian Strawther each scored 19 points, Michael Porter Jr. had 15 points and 10 rebounds, Peyton Watson contributed 14 points and Christian Braun finished with 12 points for the Nuggets.
